contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Unaka-roan-high-bluff-nc1.jpg|right|250px|thumb|The Unaka Mountains]] The '''Unaka Range''' is a [[mountain range]] on the border of [[Tennessee]] and [[North Carolina]], in the southeastern United States. It is a subrange of the [[Appalachian Mountains]] and is part of the [[Blue Ridge Mountains]] physiographic province. The Unakas stretch approximately from the [[Nolichucky River]] to the south to the [[Watauga River]] to the north. The Unakas include the prominent [[Roan Highlands]], where several summits rise above 6,000 feet. The [[Iron Mountains]] border the Unakas to the north, and the [[Bald Mountains]] border the Unakas opposite the Nolichucky to the south.<ref>{{cite web |title=Topographical Map of Chestoa, TN |publisher=TopoQuest |url=http://www.topoquest.com/map.php?lat=36.07146&lon=-82.41096&datum=nad83&zoom=16&map=auto&coord=d&mode=pan&size=l |accessdate=2011-06-07}}. Retrieved: 25 July 2008.</ref> The name ''unaka'' is rooted in the [[Cherokee language|Cherokee]] term ''unega'', meaning "white".<ref>{{cite book |first=James |last=Mooney |title=Myths of the Cherokee and Sacred Formulas of the Cherokee |location=Nashville, Tennessee |publisher=C and R Elder Publishers |year=1972 |page=542 |oclc=729245899}}</ref> The [[Cherokee National Forest]] and the [[Pisgah National Forest]] protect large sections of the Unaka Mountains. The [[Appalachian Trail]] traverses the Unaka crest. In some geological and in historical sources, the term "Unaka Range" is used to identify the entire crest of the Appalachian Mountains along the Tennessee-North Carolina border, including the Unakas, the [[Great Smoky Mountains]], the Bald Mountains, the [[Unicoi Mountains]], and the mountains in the [[Big Frog Wilderness]] and [[Little Frog Mountain Wilderness]]. ==Notable peaks== The highest point in the Unaka Range is [[Roan Mountain (Roan Highlands)|Roan High Knob]], which rises to an elevation of {{convert|6285|ft|m}}. {{clr}} {| class="wikitable sortable" ![[summit (topography)|Peak
